eu.brengard.businesscalendar.entitites

Class BusinessCalendar

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.brengard.businesscalendar.entitites.BusinessCalendar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class BusinessCalendar
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A business calendar, with typical working days and holidays.

    This class provides methods to create a typical business calendar for a company. It also provide a method to get the Duration getDuration two ZonedDateTime by counting only the time where the company is open. The company is considered open using its typical working days and holidays

    A business calendar is constituted of two objects :

    • A collection of BusinessDays defining the typical days of a company week. It is important to know that it can not contains two BusinessDays defining to the same day of week.
    • A set of LocalDate containing all the company holidays.
    Since:
    1.8
    Author:
    Nicolas BRENGARD (eu.brengard.businesscalendar.entitites@brengard.eu)
    See Also:
    java.time, Serialized Form

      • getDuration

        public java.time.Duration getDuration(java.time.ZonedDateTime startInclusive,
                                      java.time.ZonedDateTime endExclusive)
        Get the duration getDuration two zonedDateTimes. This duration is calculated from "working hours" (eg: Duration = real Duration - off hours Duration - holidays Duration).
        Parameters:
        startInclusive - the start instant, inclusive, not null.
        endExclusive - the end instant, exclusive, not null.
        Returns:
        the duration getDuration two zonedDateTimes, not null, eventually negative.
